titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3283) to enhance resources to enforce United States trade rights.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-187, by Mr. Putnam.
The amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 69.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 387.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 387, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and pursuant to the rule, the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 202 (Roll no. 432).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 200 (Roll no. 433).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/27/2005--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3283) to enhance resources to enforce United States trade rights.
